author: Peter Gallacher
comment: Best one I've used. The video feed is nice and smooth, and it stays up to date. Settings can easily be changed from the watch. Works even if the screen on the phone is off. The app doesn't create a shortcut in you're phone ether which is awesome, installs directly to the watch and launches from there!
title: Works perfectly on my Moto 360 2nd Gen paired with a Sony Z3

author: james cresswell
comment: I love this app. I have tried a few of these kind of apps and this one is the best. We'll worth the money. I like how I can take pictures without anyone knowing. Roll on the random pics. Thank you dev, I wasn't sure about the app but am happy I tried it. The app has quite a bit of lag tho which can be annoying at times. Look forward to an update that will fix this issue . Keep up the good work. A++++++
title: Works perfectly with HTC One m8 and sw3 watch

author: Jason Jones
comment: I purchased this app and it did pretty much exactly what I wanted it to do. Then one day, for some reason it just disappeared from my Huawei watch. Uninstalled and reinstalled on my Nexus 6P, but nothing. I tried to contact the developer writing a review and have gotten no response after about a month. Google will not give a refund for whatever reason. If this app works on your device, you will probably like it, but it may also simply disappear one day without warning and you are left with nothing.

author: Len Denton
comment: Sad to give this app a low rating.  i LOVED the functionality and features.  However, it vanished on my Note 5!  I could not find the app on the phone after it was initially loaded.  Total STEALTH MODE.  Uninstalled and requested refund.  I want to use it a soon as you fix this deal-killer of a bug.

author: James Pittuck
comment: Loved it on my HTC 10. But with sony xz premium, the highest resolution for video is 1080p.. A little shirt of the 4k video it can produce. And less than the 1440 that the htc 10 provided with this app. Does not work at all with an LG style watch, loads but won't record video. Please update. Thanks

author: Ben Aultowski
comment: Loved this app back in the day. Unfortunately, it's broken on newer devices and the developer seems to have abandoned it years ago. On a Google Pixel running Android 8.0 and a Moto 360 watch, it crashes immediately when you trigger the shutter. This app is completely broken, and I'm not holding my breath for an updated version.

author: Lung
comment: Not ready for prime time.  I have galaxy S7 and Moto 360 first gen.  The viewfinder lags about 10 secs behind realtime.  Maybe use wifi direct in future version?  I am not requesting a refund since it is only 2 dollars.  Would be an awsome app if it can stay near real time.  Thanks for your effort.

author: Amit Chavan
comment: Please solve the cropping problem with rear camera it crops the images please make it use all the resolution that rear camera offers. Its ok to show low resolution one on watch but actual image taken should be full size one

author: Michael Jenkins
comment: This app is just perfect. You can turn on your camera on your phone and view everything on your watch on travels I've taken the best selfies even jump shots. Just by looking at my wrist and putting my phone far away.
title: The only one legit

author: Danny Kirk
comment: I first tried lookbehind, couldn't take a picture, then I tried wear camera picture was very small and didn't fill my Huawei watch. Next I tried this on PixtoCam and its the bomb! Full picture on my Huawei watch, I can control the resolution, camera (front or back) flash, take a video or picture. Pictures show in my gallery in a separate folder called pixtoCam which is very easy to get to. Everything works perfectly, no lag like some people report. I do not work or know the developer of this app  but thank you can't stop playing with it!

author: Ken Salter
comment: Great features, wish they all worked.  Zoom not working in either video or camera mode.  Camera mode keeps crashing on my Galaxy S7.  Video works except zoom.  Confusing icons:  cameras shows active when in video mode, video cam shows active when in camera mode.  Hope this is fixed for the Galaxy S7.

author: Jeff McLaughlin
comment: It's does what it says, but the pictures aren't nearly as good as the Google camera app on the pixel 2, so it can be a mixed bag. Hopefully they will add Google's visual core support for better imagery and a higher review from me.

author: ACC Polymers
comment: I downloaded this on my Samsung C5 after paying for it. Turns out it says installed but does not show up in my apps. I sent an email to support but have not received a reply. Day light robbery!!

author: Ramon Carter
comment: I've never been this excited over an app before. There are a couple things I like to see added but I can't see not giving a 5 star Rating. It does everything. I'm not much of a selfie shooter, but I am now.  What I'd like to see added. 1: Photo Playback, so you can view the picture you just took.  2: would be nice and easier if the pictures went into the phones regular picture folder instead of its on folder. 3. Voice commands to take picture. Even without those, the app is awesome!
title: Absolutely Love this App

author: Kim Taavo
comment: I love it - easy to use and works like a charm. Having said that, I do have a problem with aspect ratio - it seems to record with an aspect ratio of 4:3 but the resulting video has a 16:9 ratio. Any tips or pointers on how to change that?

author: Cuong Vien Le
comment: After 24h using this software so make me sad. I'm missed several nice record because software crash or can not control. My battery from SmartWatch 3 drain out in 30 minutes while normal can run perfect with 2 days.
title: Crash, drain battery

author: Mark Walton
comment: Didn't work on Android Wear 2 with LG G Watch R after upgrade until I uninstalled and re-installed on phone, then then new manual install in watch. App works like before. Thanks, very useful.

author: Ian Dean
comment: Did love this app... did everything as promised but now not visible on my Sony smartwatch. Has uninstalled and reinstalled a number of times restarted Phoebe and watch.  Get notification that it's installed... but once you close app on watch unable to find it again!!

author: Chris Mather
comment: Just upgraded the Huawei watch to Android 2.0. And couldn't find this app on the watch. Google was also telling me it wasn't compatible. Trick is to uninstall on the phone and reinstall app back to phone. Then you will see a notification on the watch to manually install. Still works great on Android 2.0.

author: Gordon Lamb
comment: What a great app!  I've found a somewhat unconventional use for it, actually.  I shave my head and whenever I travel there's often no way to see if I missed a spot on the back.  Problem solved! :)

author: The Beerman
comment: I have installed this several times and it will not open and I cannot get it to sync with my gear S2 at all. Very disappointed.
title: Won't work on Note 5 with latest updates

author: Aio Wright
comment: Seems like a decent app but didn't work on my LG Watch Style. The feed was incredibly delayed and the buttons not properly formatted for the screen. Slightly annoyed that there's no option for a refund

author: Bill Bortzfield
comment: I was excited about this app BUT it isn't letting me select 4k resolution.  The video feature in my Moto360 only goes up to 1080p even though my LG G5 supports 4k, making it useless for my intended purpose.

author: Lee Lytle
comment: App was great when I used it on my Nexus 6P paired to my 2nd gen Moto 360. However, I still have the same watch that is now paired to the LG G6 and the app won't even open. I paid for this app and now I'm on a different phone it's useless 😡

author: Jesus Pagan
comment: Not working properly on Note 5. Great concept. Freezes, lags, shuts off, sometimes doesn't load. Hasn't had an update since I purchased it a few months ago.

author: Noah Peart
comment: Monitor on the camera is laggy compared to other apps, even of you lower the photo resolution. Photo quality is high, and UI is appealing, though. Update: overheats moto 360 over prolonged use.
title: Decent

author: Jeff Rhine
comment: I read the app description and saw the great reviews, but I still expected this to be some half-baked, slow responding slide show on my Huawei watch. Boy was I wrong. As mentioned in another review, the video is smooth and the controls VERY intuitive and responsive (slight lag <1 sec when pressing shutter.) the photos came out as razor sharp as if I'd been hold my phone and taking the picture normally. And the videos were equally high quality. Only con is no video streaming on watch WHILE recording video.
title: First 5 Minutes

author: Bryce Carlen
comment: It hasn't been updated in more than a year. It used to be great in my original Moto 360. on my Asus Zenwatch, it is laggy and prone to freezing.

author: Gee Bee
comment: A bit to be expected lag to watch. Also for those of us with speaker watch or even a visual indication that a photo has been taken. Button only turns red on cam recording,not photo. Otherwise excellent.
title: Works well

author: Philip Mitchell
comment: Good app when it works. Found it occasionally disappears from my SW3, not happened since I moved it to internal storage rather than SD card on my phone. Hope it helps others.

author: Mark Carter
comment: I had to uninstall and reinstall it about five times before my Huawei watch responded and gave me the option to install it. My phone is a Samsung note 4. Works perfectly now its installed though.

author: Dan L
comment: Using a Fossil Q Marshal and Note 5. Tried a few free apps but none were satisfactory. Took a leap of faith to try PixtoCam, glad that it's the best so far. But one problem is I can't find the app on my Note 5, it's completely stealthly hidden. It worries me a little. Is it a bug?
title: Best camera app for android wear

author: Steve Owen
comment: Worked perfectly with previous Nexus 5, doesn't save pics on Oneplus 3. Appears on watch but doesn't save pics. Have tried reinstalling, problem remains...
title: Doesn't save pics on Oneplus 3

author: paul richman
comment: Keeps crashing after a little time and use on my Tag Heuer Connected,  with my Note5.  Please fix, and I'll give you 5 stars.
title: Nice but...

author: Sathya Karthik
comment: The video freezes in the watch but continues to record on the phone. Please fix this other than that it is a great app. Thank you
title: Just one problem

author: Kuro Shishi
comment: Doesn't give picture preview on lg G6. That's kinda the whole point, isn't it? On other phones I've had, it worked great. For now, it's a waste of space.

author: Darnell Williams
comment: Installed on my phone but wont show on my watch. Google wont issue me a refund. Can you please fix this problem!!!!!!!!
title: Wont work on my samsung gear live

author: Carlos Menendez
comment: it's been slow, lagging, and draining my watch battery faster than a bucket with holes drains water.
title: Started out great but since the last update...

author: Quiet -
comment: Great app had to let it go it's becoming blurry and lagging not working with the new updates. Work  great with my Moto 360 first generation. I purchase a second generation Huawei

author: Matthew Harris
comment: Now if the app is open, the camera app on the crashes, Nexus 6 with Android 5.1.1.                Update: latest update fixed the issue, thanks.

reply.author: Pixtogram
reply.content: Sorry you've trouble with PixtoCam. May you update and tell us if it fixes your issue ?

title: Worked great, but not anymore...
